content: ‚ÄúIndia and the U.S. have a very positive and forward-looking Comprehensive and Global Strategic Partnership,‚Äù the Prime Minister said

content: The UNGA list of speakers for the General Debate is provisional and there is always possibility of changes in schedules and speakers ahead of the commencement of the high-level week

title: Smart televisions expected to be 8-10% cheaper

title: Trump tariff effect: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs apparel hubs are unravelling at the seams
content: From August 27, the United States has levied a 50% tariff on Indian goods exported to them, disrupting business for thousands of micro, small and medium-scale enterprises in India in sectors such as textiles, garments, and jewellery. content: The average cancer incidence in the State is estimated at 134.57 cases per one lakh population, which is significantly above India‚Äôs national average of 113 cases

title: 14,000 contractual workers of National Health Mission quit as stir enters 19th day in Chhattisgarh
content: Protest poses two-pronged challenge to BJP govt., with health services severely hit, Oppn. criticising handling of the issue; four of 10 demands accepted, says govt. official; issue notifications: protesters

title: Passenger holding areas planned at Secunderabad station ahead of festive rush
content: To ease congestion on the platforms and foot overbridges, two holding areas will be set up on Platform 1 with a combined capacity of 1,500 passengers

title: PCB data declares Hyderabad ‚Äòquiet‚Äô, residents decry late-night din
content: On August 31, the daytime decibel level recorded at Paradise was 37.71 dB. This is quieter than an office or library that will have the sound level of 40 dB

content: It allocated the amount for 98 modernisation and infrastructure augmentation projects in Chennai Port Trust, Kamarajar Port in Chennai, and VOC Port in Thoothukudi over the past 11 years, says Union Minister for Ports Sarbananda Sonowal

title: Chief Minister Naidu urges teachers to bring in innovation to help today‚Äôs tech-savvy students
content: Chief Minister asks teachers to embrace technology and use AI tools and quantum computing to guide students, says educators cannot afford to lag behind their own students or even their children and grandchildren in terms of technology

title: Congress moves High Court against expanded size of Chhattisgarh Cabinet, calls it unconstitutional
content: The induction of three Ministers following the expansion on August 20 takes the size of the Cabinet to 14 in the 90-member Assembly, which breaches the Constitutional limit of 15%, the civil writ petition filed by the party said

title: Caste census: Panel preps up with 60 questions to be posed to 7 crore people
content: The caste list is expected to be have over 1,800 community names in the State at the start of the survey on Septermber 22

title: Caught in trade war, Andhra‚Äôs aquaculture faces collapse
content: Over the past four decades, the export-oriented aquaculture in Andhra Pradesh offered sustenance to hundreds of thousands of people from across the country and shored up rural economy. The steep hike in U.S. tariff on Indian goods, however, has cast a shadow of uncertainty over the sector and the lives it supports, writes Rajulapudi Srinivas

title: Rattling the nuts and bolts in Ludhiana
content: Punjab‚Äôs industrial hub ‚Äì known for engineering tools, textiles, and basmati rice exports ‚Äì braces for the U.S. tariff fallout. While the ripple effects are not immediate, early signs such as reduced working hours and cost-cutting in factories point to an imminent impact on production and livelihoods across industrial sectors.¬†Vikas Vasudeva¬†finds that business owners are currently holding off on layoffs despite an order slump

title: Meitei group rejects Suspension of Operations pact with Kuki-Zo groups in Manipur
content: COCOMI, one of the largest Meitei civil society groups in Manipur, says the decision taken by Centre ‚Äúreflects an undemocratic and hegemonic imposition upon the indigenous people and its elected representatives of Manipur‚Äù

title: New technology, innovation conclave to ‚Äòreplace‚Äô Science Congress to be held in November
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to attend the inauguration of ESTIC; the Indian Science Congress has not been held after 2023 following a spat between DST and ISCA

title: New book on Operation Sindoor is benchmark for future military strategy, says Army Chief
content: Book by retired Lt. Gen. K.J.S. Dhillon is a tribute to Army‚Äôs courage and professionalism, says Gen. Dwivedi and adds Operation Sindoor reflected India‚Äôs resolve, strategic clarity, whole-of-nation approach

title: Collateral consequences of Ukraine conflict, including fuel price, affecting Global South: India tells UNGA
content: Underscoring that the wholehearted participation and commitment of all stakeholders is critical for lasting peace, India told the UN General Assembly that it welcomes the ‚Äòrecent positive developments‚Äô in this direction

title: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar lays foundation stone for 17 schemes worth ‚Çπ1,159.84 crore in Patna
content: The schemes include construction of bridge and approach road on Punpun river apart from capacity expansion of power transformers in 18 power substations

title: Northern States get reprieve from rain but grapple with aftermath of floods
content: Water levels in dams and rivers drop as the rain has taken a break while the IMD has predicted light to moderate rainfall at most to many places over the country‚Äôs northwest and west region during the next seven days. Many residential areas and farmland are still underwater

title: Watch: Modi, Xi, Putin get closer | Photo-op, or warning to the West?
content: From Trump tariffs to¬†the Tianjin troika - does the Modi-Xi-Putin pow-wow mean more than a photo-op? After the SCO meet and China‚Äôs military parade, can India‚Äôs eastern outreach force a rethink in the West on sanctions?

title: Bruhat, Vishala and many more: Writers offer alternatives to ‚Äògreater‚Äô
content: Karnataka govt. faced backlash from the Opposition and sparked a social media debate for using the English word ‚ÄòGreater‚Äô instead of a Kannada word while christening Greater Bengaluru Authority

title: Baramulla MP Engineer Rashid attacked in Tihar: Awami Ittehad Party
content: According to the AIP spokesman, Rashid spoke to his counsel, Advocate Javeed Hubbi, about ‚Äúharassment‚Äù inside the jail

title: Crops on 14.44 lakh hectares damaged by heavy rain, says Maharashtra government
content: Excessive monsoon showers between August 15-20 have hit 191 talukas, damaging kharif crops in 654 revenue circles, says State Agriculture Minister

title: Comparing Bihar with beedi is shameful, the BJP says
content: ‚ÄòAn attack is being made directly on the identity of Bihar and its people,‚Äô former Union Minister and BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad said of the since deleted post by the Congress‚Äôs Kerala unit

title: A.P. CM orders urgent steps to find cause of Turakapalem deaths, take up remedial action
content: Chandrababu Naidu directs officials to treat it as a health emergency and send special medical teams to the village to screen every resident and prepare a health profile to tackle the scourge

title: Congress in Kerala apologises after ‚ÄòBeedis and Bihar‚Äô post backfires
content: In an attempt to pull off a sardonic wordplay depicting the proposed lower tax on beedis as a bid to entice rural voters, the INC@Kerala wrote on X: ‚ÄúBidis and Bihar start with B. Cannot be considered sin anymore‚Äù

title: ‚ÄòDharma Jagruti Samavesha‚Äô seeks legal action against those defaming Dharmasthala
content: The convention decided to extend the scope of Dharma Samrakshana Samithi to State-level, and counter the conspiracies and campaigns targetted against Hindu religious places of worship. It also decided to hold the convention once a year

title: Teachers are architects of society, says Chittoor Collector
content: He urges teachers to guide underprivileged children, instil values, and protect students from negative influences during Teachers‚Äô Day celebrations

title: Vidya Parirakshana Cycle Yatra highlights students‚Äô issues in Prakasam
content: The eight-day yatra, covering 380 km across the district, draws attention to delayed fee reimbursements, high hostel charges, and challenges faced by students under the new National Education Policy

title: GST relief, subsidies, and innovations boost Andhra Pradesh‚Äôs livestock and poultry sector, says official
content: ‚ÄòGovernment initiatives are helping farmers increase milk and meat production, expand poultry operations, and strengthen biosecurity measures across the State‚Äô

title: CM welcomes revamped GST rates, but says the benefits should reach common man
content: If the benefits fail to reach the common man, the blame will rest squarely on the Union government: Siddaramaiah

title: Recent recusals in Supreme Court, HC, tribunal send mixed signals on transparency
content: No formal rules govern recusals by judges; SC judge M.M. Sundresh recently exited bail plea case  without providing any reason; bucking the trend, NCLAT judge, M.P. HC judge opted for transparency

title: States should be given 75% of GST revenue, says Appavu
content: Centre receives enormous revenues through GST, IT, sale of fuel and railways, but it does not release funds for even the school education of poor children, says Speaker

title: Five workers missing after water release from dam floods Gujarat hydropower plant
content: The police say there were 15 workers on maintenance duty inside a 60-ft deep well in the plant when water was released from the Kadana dam upstream. While 10 of them managed to escape, five people are yet to be traced.

title: EAGLE chief warns students against drug use
content: He highlights cases of students caught in drug-related offences and urges youth to stay vigilant and report peddlers via WhatsApp

title: Jaishankar to join Brazil-led BRICS virtual summit on Trump tariffs: MEA
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin will attend summit called by Brazil President Lula; the meet is likely to irk Washington that views the BRICS as ‚Äúanti-American‚Äù

title: ‚ÄòFully reciprocate sentiments‚Äô: PM Modi reacts to Trump's stance on India-US ties amid tariff row
content: Amid strained bilateral ties due to Washington's tariffs, PM Modi responded to President Trump's praise, reciprocating his sentiments and highlighting the positive strategic partnership between India and the US. Trump expressed disappointment over India's oil trade with Russia and defended the imposed tariffs, despite affirming his friendship with PM Modi and acknowledging the special relationship between the two nations.

title: Mumbai scare: Man who sent 'human bombs, RDX' terror threat arrested; cops traced sim
content: Crime Branch have arrested Ashwin Kumar Supra from Noida for allegedly sending bomb threat messages to the Mumbai Traffic Police's WhatsApp helpline. The threat claimed 14 terrorists had entered the city with explosives. The message, identifying the sender as 'Lashkar-e-Jihadi,' prompted a thorough investigation involving multiple agencies.

title: Women's World Cup: Pak to skip opening ceremony in Guwahati; clash with India on Oct 5
content: Pakistan's women's cricket team will not attend the ICC Women's World Cup opening ceremony in India, aligning with a recent agreement between the two nations to avoid cross-border travel for ICC tournaments. Political tensions continue to impact sporting relations, as evidenced by India's previous decision to skip the Champions Trophy in Pakistan.

title: Mid-air scare: Abu Dhabi-bound IndiGo flight suffers tech snag; returns to Kochi
content: An IndiGo flight, 6E-1403, en route from Kochi to Abu Dhabi with over 180 passengers, had to make an unscheduled return to Kochi early Saturday morning. The A320 neo aircraft experienced a technical issue mid-air after flying for over two hours, prompting the diversion.

title: UNGA session: PM Modi likely to skip this year amid tariff row; Jaishankar to represent India
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is set to represent India at the upcoming UN General Assembly in New York. While a slot was reserved for PM Modi, his participation remains uncertain. Sources suggest a meeting with President Trump is unlikely due to ongoing trade talks and recent diplomatic tensions.

title: Bill Gates but not Musk invited to Trump‚Äôs dinner, says Twitter user: Tesla CEO responds
content: President Trump hosted tech leaders at the White House, but Elon Musk was notably absent, despite being invited. Musk cited a scheduling conflict and sent a representative. Trump downplayed their past feud, suggesting Musk would eventually return to the Republican Party, despite disagreements over tax policies and electric vehicle credits.

title: Brics 2025: S Jaishankar to represent India at virtual summit; PM Modi to skip
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will represent India at the Brics virtual summit convened by Brazil, focusing on Trump's tariffs and multilateralism. PM Modi's absence, despite India assuming the Brics presidency next year, signals a balancing act amid trade tensions with the US. The summit occurs amidst US Commerce Secretary's threats of tariffs against India for its Brics participation.

title: US Open final: Alcaraz beats Djokovic; sets historic third straight Slam clash with Sinner
content: Carlos Alcaraz defeated Novak Djokovic in the US Open semifinal. Jannik Sinner won against Felix Auger-Aliassime. Sinner and Alcaraz will compete in the US Open final. This is a historic match. The same two players will face each other in three consecutive grand slam finals this season. The winner will claim the world No. 1 ranking.

title: Meta‚Äôs brain drain: Why AI engineers quit; startup CEO cites Zuckerberg‚Äôs own words
content: Memories.ai CEO Shawn Shen reveals that Meta's frequent reorganizations are driving AI researchers to seek opportunities elsewhere, including his own startup. Memories.ai is offering lucrative compensation packages, up to $2 million, to attract top talent. The company has already hired a former Meta research scientist as its chief AI officer and plans to expand its AI team significantly.

title: Lights out, lessons lost, lives rebuilt: How a flooded Yamuna has redrawn Delhi map
content: Civil Lines grapples with receding floodwaters but remains without power for three days due to a submerged transformer. Residents face sewer backflow and water contamination, prompting calls for a permanent solution to the recurring flooding. Tata Power DDL advises safety precautions and is awaiting safe water levels to restore electricity after safety checks.

title: Delhi: Newlywed woman stabbed by ‚Äòstalker‚Äô in Mustafabad; accused arrested
content: In New Delhi, a newlywed 18-year-old woman is in critical condition after being stabbed by her stalker in New Mustafabad. The incident occurred as she was preparing to return to her husband's home after post-wedding ceremonies.

title: Trump to tech CEOs: 'Google had a very good day yesterday'; CEO Sundar Pichai replies
content: Donald Trump held a White House dinner for tech leaders. He congratulated Google's Sundar Pichai on winning an antitrust case. Pichai thanked Trump's administration for constructive dialogue. He praised the US AI action plan. Trump incorrectly blamed Joe Biden for the Google lawsuit. Google and Trump are still in legal discussions over YouTube censorship.

title: Grand Swiss: D Gukesh denied win by 14-year-old; Vaishali shares lead in women's section
content: Indian grandmasters are making waves at the FIDE Grand Swiss! D Gukesh drew a tense match, while defending champion R Vaishali secured another victory. Praggnanandhaa clinched his first tournament win. Alireza Firouzja, Parham Maghsoodloo, and Anton Demchenko lead the open section. Vaishali and Olga Bedelka share the lead in the women's section.

title: Chiefs‚Äô defence exposed: Herbert outshines Mahomes; Brazil opener stuns
content: Justin Herbert threw for 318 yards and three TDs as the Chargers snapped a seven-game skid against Kansas City with a 27-21 win in S√£o Paulo. Patrick Mahomes kept the Chiefs alive late, but injuries, missed kicks, and a lack of defensive pressure proved costly. Analyst called the pass rush ‚Äúconcerning.‚Äù

title: Firms have to pass on GST cuts, I'll focus on it from September 22: FM
content: FM Nirmala Sitharaman emphasized that companies must pass on GST rate reductions to consumers. Effective September 22, these reforms aim to benefit the common man, farmers, and small businesses. The government is closely monitoring prices and working with industries to ensure full transfer of gains.

title: US Open 2025: Alcaraz beats Djokovic; Spaniard reaches third straight grand slam final
content: Carlos Alcaraz showcased his dynamic game to defeat Novak Djokovic in the US Open semifinals, securing his spot in a third consecutive Grand Slam final. Djokovic, feeling the effects of age and physical limitations, acknowledged Alcaraz's superior energy. Alcaraz will now compete for the championship against either Jannik Sinner or Felix Auger-Aliassime.

title: 'Caught on cam': Pakistan's jailed former PM Imran Khan's sister hit with egg - Video
content: Aleema Khan, sister of jailed former PM Imran Khan, was attacked with an egg while addressing reporters outside Adiala Jail. PTI supporters apprehended two women accused of the act, alleging a political motive and police involvement in their escape. The incident drew condemnation from across the political spectrum, with leaders denouncing it as a shameful and vile act.

title: Rainha dos Chiefs: Taylor Swift‚Äôs showgirl life steals spotlight
content: Pop icon Taylor Swift's presence has become a lucky charm for Travis Kelce and Kansas City Chiefs. She has attended 23 games since 2023, with the team winning 19. As the Chiefs start their 2025-26 season in Sao Paulo against the Chargers, speculation surrounds Swift's attendance. Her support could set the stage for another championship run.

title: 'Lost India' to China? Trump goes into damage control mode; claims 'nothing to worry about'
content: After incendiary remarks strained ties with India, President Trump attempted damage control, affirming the "special relationship" despite disappointment over India's Russian oil purchases, threatening a 50% tariff. This came after India rejected US demands, asserting its right to choose its oil sources. While some US officials adopted a confrontational stance, others signaled a desire to maintain the consequential relationship.

title: Goyal calls GST rate cuts 'historic', slams Cong for its 'high-tax legacy'
content: The government hailed the latest GST rate cuts as a historic step, reducing consumer burden and boosting demand, while sharply criticizing the Congress party for a high-taxation past and failure to build consensus on reforms. Union Minister Piyush Goyal contrasted the current government's actions with the UPA era, highlighting economic growth and dismissing allegations of politically motivated reforms.

title: The Bengal Files day 1: Vivek Agnihotri film opens with Rs 1.75 cr
content: Vivek Agnihotri's controversial film, 'The Bengal Files', faced a modest opening, earning approximately Rs 1.75 crore amidst clashes with 'Baaghi 4'. The film's release was marred by alleged theatre pressure in West Bengal, with actress Pallavi Joshi decrying an ‚Äúunofficial ban‚Äù. 'Baaghi 4' overshadowed 'The Bengal Files', collecting around Rs 12 crore on the same day.

title: Checking blood pressure: Wrong timing may mislead; correct way to do it
content: Blood pressure levels in the body experience natural fluctuations, during different periods of the day. The body experiences natural fluctuations in blood pressure because of its internal cycles, physical activities and environmental elements. The body experiences its lowest blood pressure during rest periods and sleep

title: HAL to deliver to IAF first 2 'improved' Tejas Mark-1A in October
content: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) aims to deliver the first two 'improved' Tejas Mark-1A fighters to the IAF next month, pending successful weapon firing trials. Delays are attributed to engine delivery issues from General Electric and weapon integration challenges. The IAF, facing squadron shortages, awaits the delivery of 83 Tejas Mark-1A jets and has ordered 97 more.

title: ‚ÄòBaaghi 4‚Äô day 1 collection: Tiger Shroff starrer opens to Rs 12 cr at box office
content: Tiger Shroff's Baaghi 4 opened with an average ‚Çπ12 crore on its first day, impacted by The Conjuring: Last Rites' record-breaking debut of ‚Çπ18 crore. Despite strong advance bookings, inflated numbers tempered expectations. Directed by A. Harsha and featuring a stellar cast, Baaghi 4 aims to continue the franchise's action legacy.

title: Desi hypersonic missiles, AI system on defence minister wish list
content: India's defence ministry has unveiled a 15-year technology roadmap, outlining requirements for the domestic industry. The roadmap includes over 200 weapon systems and futuristic technologies, such as hypersonic missiles, stealth drones, and AI-driven systems. The Navy seeks nuclear-powered warships, while the Army needs next-gen tanks. The IAF desires stratospheric airships. This initiative aims to boost self-reliance in defence manufacturing.

title: Fourth quake hits Afghanistan days after 2,200 killed in deadly temblors
content: Afghanistan has been struck by a magnitude 5 earthquake on Friday night, adding to a series of quakes that hit the nation earlier in the day. This recent seismic activity follows a devastating earthquake on Sunday, which resulted in a death toll exceeding 2,200.

title: Shilo Sanders and NFL: From Colorado standout to free agent ‚Äî latest update
content: Shilo Sanders, after being released by the Tampa Bay Buccaneers following a preseason ejection for throwing a punch, remains without an NFL team. Despite his agents seeking opportunities, including practice squad positions, no team has claimed him. The Toronto Argonauts hold his CFL rights, and the UFL could be an option next year if an NFL deal doesn't materialize.

title: 'India supports early end of conflict': MEA backs peace push on Ukraine
content: India has reaffirmed its commitment to a swift resolution of the Ukraine conflict and the restoration of lasting peace, expressing support for recent peace initiatives. External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar discussed the situation with his Ukrainian counterpart, who sought India's active involvement in peace efforts.

title: Roads shut, 4 pay Rs 10k each for copter to exam centre
content: Due to landslides blocking road access to Munsyari in Uttarakhand, four BEd students from Rajasthan chartered a helicopter from Haldwani to ensure they could take their examination.

title: Amid a trade war initiated by Trump, a partnership in defense
content: Despite trade tensions initiated by the U.S., India and the U.S. are engaged in Exercise Yudh Abhyas 2025 in Alaska, a large-scale military drill involving 450 Indian Army personnel. The exercise, focused on high-altitude operations and interoperability, underscores the strong defense partnership between the two nations. India emphasizes its commitment to the U.S.

title: PIL challenges minority quota in HC judge selection
content: A PIL has been filed in the Supreme Court challenging the collegium system's practice of considering minority community status when recommending candidates for High Court judgeships. The petitioners argue that such quotas based on religion violate the principle of secularism enshrined in the Constitution.

title: From Rs 20 to Rs 100: Coconuts turn luxury in India; prices shoot up amid Onam
content: Across South India, coconut prices have surged from Rs 15-25 to Rs 80-100 due to pandemic-induced supply chain disruptions, climate change impacts, and pest infestations. Neglect of plantations, coupled with increased demand during festivals and tourism, has exacerbated the shortage.

title: Meitei, Kuki groups junk Centre's Manipur 'deals'
content: The fragile peace process in Manipur faces setbacks as Meitei and Kuki-Zo groups reject Centre's deals aimed at restoring normalcy. Kuki-Zo groups deny reopening NH2 highway, while Meitei organizations criticize the extension of the SoO agreement with tribal militant outfits, deeming it illegitimate and undermining democratic principles amidst President's rule.

title: Leicester‚Äôs Diwali celebrations scaled back; police probe Ganesh Chaturthi procession
content: Leicester's Diwali celebrations are significantly scaled back this year due to public safety concerns raised by a safety advisory group, leading to the cancellation of the Diwali village, stage show, and fireworks. The decision follows a record attendance of 55,000 people last year and concerns about overcrowding and emergency access.

title: 'Misleading': India rejects Navarro's remark; calls it 'inaccurate'
content: India's Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has strongly refuted US trade advisor Peter Navarro's accusations of India "profiteering" from Russian crude and indirectly supporting the Ukraine war. The MEA emphasized the importance of the India-US strategic partnership, built on shared interests and mutual respect, while dismissing speculation about Trump's attendance at the upcoming Quad summit.

title: Two South Korean mountaineers rescued in Ladakh, one dies
content: In a daring rescue operation, the Indian Army's Fire and Fury Corps airlifted two critically ill South Korean mountaineers from a remote peak near Kongmarula in Ladakh. The challenging night evacuation was executed from an altitude of 17,000 feet, with the climbers transported to SNM Hospital in Leh. Tragically, one of the mountaineers passed away while undergoing treatment.

title: '34 vehicles ready with human bombs': Lashkar-e-Jihadi sends warning; Mumbai on high alert
content: Mumbai Police are on high alert. A threat message warned of multiple terror attacks. The message claimed 34 vehicles are fitted with human bombs. Lashkar-e-Jihadi claimed responsibility. They said 14 Pakistani terrorists entered India. The threat mentioned 400 kg of RDX explosives. Mumbai Police are investigating the threat. Security has been tightened across the city.

title: Trump admin outlines major reforms for H-1B visas- Here's what you need to know
content: The Trump administration is planning significant H-1B visa program changes, including stricter eligibility and compliance. A proposal slated for December 2025 aims to revise cap exemptions and tighten third-party placement rules. Another rule would prioritize higher-wage earners in visa allocation, potentially impacting Indian beneficiaries and tech companies relying on the program.

title: 'India will say sorry and make a deal': US commerce secretary Howard Lutnick
content: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick anticipates India will apologize and negotiate with President Trump, drawing parallels to Canada's trade concessions. He cautioned India to cease purchasing Russian oil, withdraw from BRICS, and support the US, or face substantial tariffs. Lutnick emphasized the US's economic dominance and its role as a primary consumer market.

title: Op Sindoor: CDS explains why India used air power; how targets were selected
content: CDS Anil Chauhan stated that India employed air power in Operation Sindoor to dismantle terrorist camps in Bahawalpur and Muridke, as drones and loitering munitions were deemed insufficient to achieve the desired political objectives. This decision followed the Pahalgam terror attack and reflected India's enhanced precision strike capabilities developed after the Balakot operation.

title: Banner day for Eagles as champs hold off Cowboys in wild one
content: defensive tackle was ejected for spitting on Dallas Cowboys quarterback dak Prescott . the rivalry game remained as intense from start to lightning-delayed finish . both defenses took some time to stabilize before eventually finding their footing .

title: "Fully Reciprocate His Sentiments": PM Modi On Trump's "Will Always Be Friends" Remark
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday responded to US President Donald Trump, saying the two leaders would "always be friends", saying he "fully reciprocates his sentiments".

title: Ganesh Visarjan 2025 Live Updates: Huge Celebrations Across India Today, Cops Issue Traffic Advisories
content: Ganesh Chaturthi celebrations are set to conclude today with Ganesh Visarjan, the final day of the 10-day Ganeshotsav celebrations which began on August 27.

title: Delhi High Court Orders Rs 1 Crore Aid To School Principal's Family Who Died On Covid Duty
content: The Delhi High Court has directed the government in the capital to pay Rs 1 crore ex-gratia to the family of a school principal who died while discharging COVID-19 duties.

title: 790-Page Chargesheet Filed In Meghalaya Honeymoon Murder Case, Sonam Main Accused
content: A Special Investigation Team (SIT) of the Meghalaya Police has filed its chargesheet in the Raja Raghuvanshi murder case, and charged the victim's wife Sonam Raghuvanshi, her lover Raj Kushwaha and three others with murder.

title: "Don't Think We Have": Trump Responds To His "Lost India" To China Remark
content: US President Donald Trump on Friday responded to his Truth Social post claiming that US has "lost India and Russia to China," saying he does not believe that has happened.

title: Trump Asked If He Is Ready To Reset Relations With India. His Response
content: Donald Trump on Friday said that it "looks like we've lost India and Russia to deepest, darkest China".

title: "Tough And Nasty": Trump Says US Is In "Very Deep Negotiations" With Hamas
content: US President Donald Trump said on Friday that Washington was in "very deep" negotiations with Hamas and urged them to release all hostages held in Gaza.

title: Trump Threatens To "Shoot Down" Venezuelan Jets If They "Pose Danger To US"
content: Donald Trump on Friday threatened to shoot down Venezuelan military jets if they pose a danger to US forces, as Washington deploys F-35 warplanes to Puerto Rico.

title: "Theaterisation Will Come, Today Or Tomorrow": Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi
content: Army Chief General Upendra Dwivedi on Friday asserted that theaterisation -- or the integration of Army, Air Force and Navy capabilities -- will take definitely take place and the question is only about how long it would take to materialise.

title: PM Modi To Skip UN Session, S Jaishankar Likely To Represent India
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will not address the General Debate at the annual high-level session of the United Nations General Assembly later this month.

title: Gurugram Metro To Connect 27 Stations In 4 Years With Rs 5,500 Crore Investment
content: Union Minister Manohar Lal Khattar and Haryana Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini on Friday participated in the foundation laying ceremony of a new metro line connecting 27 stations in Gurugram.

title: A 3 Crore Ransom, Then Firing In Lisbon: Indian Gangs' Terror In Portugal
content: Indian gangster Randeep Malik, linked to the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, had demanded a ransom of Rs 3 crore, businessman Romi King has told NDTV.

title: US Commandos Killed North Korean Civilians In Botched 2019 Mission: Report
content: US commandos launched an audacious operation in 2019 to plant a listening device in North Korea to spy on Kim Jong Un, but the mission quickly unraveled and culminated in the deaths of multiple civilians.

title: "Trump Upset With India For Continuously Funding Ukraine War": US Advisor
content: White House Economic Advisor Kevin Hassett has said that President Donald Trump and his trade team are "disappointed" with India's ongoing imports of Russian crude oil, but expressed hope for positive developments in the near future.

title: UP Man Jailed For Life For Raping Minor Girl
content: A local court sentenced a man to life imprisonment on Friday after convicting him for rape of a minor girl nine years ago.

title: US In "Very Deep" Negotiations With Hamas To Free Hostages, Says Trump
content: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday that Washington was in "very deep" negotiations with Palestinian militant group Hamas and urged them to release all hostages held in Gaza.

title: 2 Men Shot Dead By Unidentified Persons In Delhi: Cops
content: Two men were allegedly shot dead by unidentified persons in northeast Delhi's Pratap Nagar on Friday evening, police said.

title: New York Mayor Eric Adams Says Won't Quit Race, Can Beat Zohran Mamdani
content: New York City Mayor Eric Adams insisted again Friday that he won't end his reelection campaign, stressing that he'll remain in the race as reports swirl that he's been approached about possibly taking a job in the Trump administration.

title: Trump To Host 2026 G20 Summit At His Own Miami Golf Resort
content: US President Donald Trump said Friday he would host the 2026 G20 summit at his own golf resort in Miami -- despite abandoning a similar move in his first term after accusations of corruption.

title: Trump Signs Order Renaming Pentagon As 'Department Of War'
content: President Donald Trump signed an executive order Friday renaming the Department of Defense as the Department of War  a long-telegraphed move aimed at projecting American military toughness around the globe.

title: Can you import an entire offense? OU hopes so with John Mateer, Ben Arbuckle
content: new: n.c. coach bill Belichick stepped in with a substantial financial figure of its own . new: bill belichick, whose Tar Heels lodged a sizable bid, is stepping in with its own financial figure . he'll face no. 14 Michigan on tuesday in a game against the u.s.
